main_point: The professor explains Sampling bias and dataset shift and how to interpret evidence when measurements can be misleading.
detail1: The professor distinguishes dataset shift (a process) from p-value (a proxy/measurement).
detail2: He suggests testing an asymmetric prediction involving false discovery rate and statistical power.
attitude: Casual but analytical; he warns against over-trusting a neat correlation.
organization_point: He adds a tangent about a tools tangent to show real-world constraints.
connecting_point: The example about controlling for baseline shows how bias can flip an apparent pattern.
